page.title: 01COLCHESTER TOWN CENTRE
page.content: This area surveyed covers the town centre of Colchester, often claimed to be the oldest recorded town in Britain,as well as the areas immediately to the north and north west of the town. The N.W., towards the village of W.Bergholt is extensively agricultural land.Colchester golf club takes up a large proportion of land as does the new District General Hospital to the North. An important feature is the extremely busy railway station that has to cater for the many thousands who commute daily to work in London. It is impossible to describe this area of Colchester without referring to its wealth of history that plays such an important part in the town.
